SEARCH
Package CORE

Class Event

java.lang.Object
CORE.Event
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Event>
public class Event extends Object implements Comparable<Event>
Represents a scheduled event within the simulation. Each event has a specific execution time, an associated individual (which may be null), and an Event_Strategy that defines the behavior to be performed when the event occurs.

This class implements Comparable to allow events to be ordered, typically by their execution time, which is crucial for event-driven simulation.

  • Field Details

    • time

      private int time
      The scheduled time at which this event is to occur. Events with lower time values are processed earlier.

    • individual

      private Individual individual
      The individual (e.g., an agent, a moving entity) associated with this event. This can be null if the event is not specific to a particular individual.

    • strategy

      private Event_Strategy strategy
      The strategy that defines the action to be performed when this event is executed. This encapsulates the specific behavior of the event.

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event(int time, Individual individual, Event_Strategy strategy)
      Constructs a new Event with the specified time, individual, and event strategy.
      Parameters:
      time - The scheduled time for this event to occur.
      individual - The individual associated with this event (can be null).
      strategy - The Event_Strategy defining the action for this event.

  • Method Details

    • getTime

      public int getTime()
      Returns the scheduled time of this event.
      Returns:
      The time of the event.

    • getIndividual

      public Individual getIndividual()
      Returns the individual associated with this event.
      Returns:
      The Individual associated with the event, or null if none.

    • execute

      public void execute(Simulation_Context simContext)
      Executes the action defined by this event's strategy. This method delegates the actual behavior to the Event_Strategy associated with this event, passing the simulation context and the individual.
      Parameters:
      simContext - The Simulation_Context providing access to shared simulation state.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Event other)
      Compares this event with the specified event for order. Events are ordered primarily by their time. If times are equal, a secondary comparison criteria (e.g., individual hash code or strategy hash code) could be added for a stable sort, though for simplicity, only time is used here.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Event>
      Parameters:
      other - The event to be compared.
      Returns:
      A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this event's time is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified event's time.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
